text: a lot of people are still trying to
figure out what really happened this
morning a couple of things seem to go
wrong at the deeply troubled Fukushima
reactor this morning one was that about
half past six you had an explosion in
reactor 2 reactor 2 for a while it
seemed like the reactor with the fewest
problems it's the only one for example
that still has a roof on its secondary
containment building but reactor 2 began
to get in trouble Monday night they
actually ran out of fuel for the fire
pumps that were pumping in seawater as a
result there was four or five hours in
which the reactor got hotter and hotter
they finally were able to resume trying
to pump seawater but they had very high
pressure inside the reactor they finally
were able to get to bleed out some of
that pressure early this morning but
when the pressure with the vapor is
being released from the reactor chamber
it's going down into essentially a
million gallon swimming pool below it
that swimming pool is supposed to have
gases on top of it that will not react
that cannot have explosions
unfortunately it seems as though the
system had somehow begun leaking already
some oxygen was in there and when they
were pumping out the vapors from the
reaction chamber they were bubbling
through this swimming pool and as they
were coming out of the swimming pool in
effect you had an explosion that
explosion then seems to have breached
the inner containment building and that
appears to be the first time that has
happened to during this whole mess in
Japan
you
